I can only confirm previous reviews which give this hotel a top rank. At the reception desk the staff are very friendly and the concierge helps you in any way. The views are breathtaking, the facilities unmachted, the rooms large and very sunny and the food great. All this does, of course, have a price. Quite reasonable in March but I also made a booking for July and then it is double. Breakfast is not included and I find the price of EUR 30.- per person too expensive. Nevertheless, the overall value is good. We were a group of several people, all travelling individually, and we all had to pay about EUR 100.- for the taxi trip from Nice airport (one way). We all found this unreasonable but it seems to be an agreed price. Would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.
reviews.title: A great place in every respect

reviews.text: This modern and luxurious hotel is situated on the outskirts of Monte Carlo and offers a fantastic view on the meditaranian sea. The hotellobby is modern, large and extremely nice. The bars and restaurants meet the highest norms and the rooms are bright, have nice and modern furniture and up-to-date facilities. Staying in thsi hotel is a real pleasure; the staff is professional, friendly and the atmosphere is one of total relaxation. The breakfast buffet is very complete and offers a very nice and qualitative choice. In front of the hotel stops a city bus, which takes you around Monte Carlo without the hassle of finding a parking space: really convenient. We would certaily recommend this hotel !
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with great view

All in all, great place. Enjoyed the helicopter transfers to Nice Airport, Hotel has a private heli-pad.

description: Cultivating a relaxed, sophisticated atmosphere, the Monte-Carlo Bay Hotel & Resort offers a new approach for a legendary destination where lightness, indulgence and good times reign.The Monte-Carlo Bay Hotel & Resort is an authentic prestigious club nested on a dream-like island, renewing the spirit of the legend and splendor of the 30’s, chic and light, luxurious and relaxed.Once through the hotel entrance, designed to mimic that of a private residence, a solarium, terraces, cascades and gardens signed by Jean Mus all play their part in creating a new Garden of Eden of pleasure and elegance.Situated parallel to the eastern of the Larvotto peninsula on Avenue Princesse Grasse, the Resort offers a sweeping view of the tip of Roquebrune-Cap-Martin and the Monte-Carlo Beach complex.
